section: Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider. <*$p$*>
explanation: This section states that Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider. However, in Section 1.3, it mentions 'Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to prevent the Recipient from itself performing or from acquiring services from other providers that are similar to or identical to the Services.' This section allows the Recipient to acquire similar services from other providers. Although these are not the provider representatives themselves, they are representatives from other companies that provide similar services. Therefore, the Provider representatives are not solely providing services to the Recipient, meaning there is a contradiction.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence is structurally flawed and doesn't make logical sense. It appears to have a duplicated phrase ("Agreement") and lacks clarity in its intended meaning. This makes the intended meaning ambiguous and difficult to understand. It also mentions it will terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2. However, section 3.2 states that each of the Recipient and the Provider may, in their sole discretion, terminate this Agreement in whole or in part, at any time without cause, and without liability except, in the case of the Recipient, for required payment for services rendered and reimbursement for authorized expenses incurred, by providing at least 90 (ninety) days' prior written notice to the other party (such date, the "Services Termination Date"). Based on this clause, it can be terminated at anytime but it needs to be 90 days prior. This clause does not align with this agreement expiring in December 31, 2020.

section: Provider shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Recipient and its officers, directors, employees, agents, affiliates, successors, and permitted assigns (collectively, "Indemnified Party") against any and all losses, damages, liabilities, deficiencies, claims, actions, judgments, settlements, interest, awards, penalties, fines, costs, or expenses of whatever kind, including attorneys' fees, fees and the costs of enforcing any right to indemnification under this Agreement, and the cost of pursuing any insurance providers, incurred by Indemnified Party or awarded against Indemnified Party (collectively, "Losses"), relating to/arising out of or resulting from any claim of a third party or Recipient arising out of or occurring in connection with Provider's negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement. <*$p$*>
explanation: This section states that the provider shall indemnify Recipient for losses arising out of or resulting from any claim of a third party or Recipient arising out of or occurring in connection with Provider's negligence, willful misconduct, or breach of this Agreement. This is an ambiguity in text because there is an inconsistency with who the claim can come from, whether it's from the third party or the Recipient. It is unusual for an indemnification clause to cover claims made directly by the Indemnified Party (Recipient in this case) against the Indemnifying Party (Provider). Indemnification is typically for third-party claims.
